title: College Degree for Software Developers? | Engineering Management
description: After interviewing hundreds of software engineers over the last 2 decades, I've determined that lived experience far outweighs the value of any university degree.

title: Steal these Awards to Build a Great Team Culture | Engineering Leadership
description:
These quarterly awards -- and our approach to running them -- were representative of our incredible organizational culture. 

The Rock - for showing determination and poise in a challenging situation
The Spearhead - for taking a leadership role in pursuit of a new effort
The Bridge - for making connections across teams

Would you consider a similar approach for your team?

title: Hiring Rock Stars and Ninjas? | Engineering Management
description: This is a just a quick Public Service Announcement for those of you who are hiring "rock stars" and "ninjas".

title: Praise in Public, Criticize in Private | Engineering Management
description: If you're an engineering manager, you're responsible for guiding the careers of others. You'll have to deliver both praise and critical feedback. Do it right!

title: Improve Morale on Your Dev Team | Engineering Leadership
description: When you're a software engineer, you hear bad news all the time (alerts, bug reports, disappointed internal teams). Does it ever end? No, but there IS something you CAN do as a leader.

title: How to Run Great 1-on-1s | Engineering Management
description: If you're an Engineering Manager, running frequent, meaningful is arguably the most important thing you can do. After 25 years in the business, here's the approach I took to ensure that direct reports felt heard and supported every step of the way.

title: Tell someone today... | Engineering Leadership
description: Everyone likes to feel appreciated now and again. #leadership #gratitude #appreciation #thanks #relationships

title: Software Engineer Today, Priest Tomorrow? | Engineering Management
description: I once had a veteran software engineer who knew that, ultimately, he wanted to join the clergy. Here's how we used his 1-on-1s to take steps on his Life Path while also making him a stronger developer.

title: Build an Engineering Career Ladder? | Engineering Management
description:
Establishing a documented career ladder for the software developers on your team is one of most important things you'll do as an engineering leader. Devs move on when they feel theyâ€™ve stalled. Put them on a clear path!

Here's the GitHub repository of example engineering career ladders:
https://github.com/bmoeskau/engineering-ladders

Steal one and tweak to taste!

title: One Simple Tip to Attract Software Developers | Engineering Leadership
description: If you're an engineering manager, you'll have to write a job description to attract software engineers to your team. Make this one small change in your job postings to set yourself apart and bring in the best talent.

title: Fun Events for Software Engineers | Engineering Leadership
description: We can do a lot better than a group trip to a bar. Software developers are a naturally creative group of problem solvers. Tap into that!

title: VENTING FRUSTRATIONS in your 1-on-1s? | Engineering Management
description: As an Engineering Manager, your 1-on-1s are your MOST important meetings. It's important to give space for venting frustrations, but they shouldn't be end-to-end rants. Here are some tips for ensuring they stay productive while also giving direct reports significant opportunity to vent their concerns.

title: Long Live the Feedback Sandwich | Interrupting Direct Report Followup
description: Delivering feedback in a positive - constructive - positive format is dead? Nah, you're just doing it wrong. You can be direct AND be kind and supportive.

title: Direct Report CONSTANTLY Interrupting? | Delivering Feedback as a Manager
description: How do you handle a direct report who interrupts you frequently? Great question! It's time to deliver some constructive feedback.

title: Interview Tips | The Best End-of-Interview Question
description: Unsure how to end an interview with a candidate? After many hundreds of interviews, here's my favorite final question to wrap things up. Use it!

title: Interview Tips | One Great Question for Senior Management Hires
description: Are you unsure how to interview a manager or someone at an executive level? After conducting hundreds of such interviews, here's my favorite question prompt of all time. Good luck!
